oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Heat transport in low dimensions: introduction and phenomenology
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lepri, Stefano
Livi, Roberto
Politi, Antonio
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Condensed Matter - Statistical Mechanics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this chapter we introduce some of the basic models and concepts that will be discussed throughout the volume. In particular we describe systems of nonlinear oscillators arranged on low-dimensional lattices and summarize the phenomenology of their transport properties.
Comment: Review paper, to appear in the Springer Lecture Notes in Physics volume "Thermal transport in low dimensions: from statistical physics to nanoscale heat transfer" (S. Lepri ed.)
